page.title: 20FLORA AND FAUNA IN CONNEL
page.content: The area is rich in both flora and fauna.Two entomologists have recently come to study the dragonflies at the Black Lochs.It is said there are two rare species there. Most common varieties of woodland birds are to be found.About 140 birds breed in the area and about 50 others are resident here.Sea birds(various gulls,heron,terns,cormorants and duck) are also in plentiful supply. Both seal and otter can be found in Loch Etive while roe deer,red deer, stoat,weasel and badger can also be seen. Trees found are mainly sycamore,birch, holly,hazel and rowan. Wild flowers include orchid,flag iris, bluebell,wild pansies,wood anemone, snowdrop,thrift,sea campion and harebell.
